recipe.title: Slow Cooker Turkey Chili With Cornbread Dumplings Recipe by Tasty

ingredients.ingredient: 1 ; red bell pepper, seeded and diced
1 ; yellow bell pepper, seeded and diced
15 oz ; black beans, 1 can, drained and rinsed ; (425 g)
15 oz ; pinto bean, 1 can, drained and rinsed ; (425 g)
¼ cup ; fresh cilantro, chopped ; (10 g)

steps.step: Combine the ground turkey, onion, bell peppers, garlic, crushed tomatoes, black and pinto beans, corn, chili powder, pepper, and salt in the bowl of a slow cooker.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 4 hours.
Once the chili has cooked for 6-8 hours, make the dumplings: Combine the eggs, melted butter, milk, and brown sugar in a large bowl.
Add the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt and stir until smooth. Fold in the cheese.
Using a small ice cream scoop, dollop the batter on top of the chili and cook for 2 more hours on low or 1 hour on high, until the dumplings are puffed and tender.
If using, garnish the chili with jalapeño, cilantro, and green onions.

steps_updated.steps_updated: Combine the ground turkey, onion, bell peppers, garlic, crushed tomatoes, black and pinto beans, corn, chili powder, pepper, and salt in the bowl of a slow cooker.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 4 hours.
Once the chili has cooked for 6-8 hours, make the dumplings: Combine the eggs, melted butter, milk, and brown sugar in a large bowl.
Add the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt and stir until smooth.
Using a small ice cream scoop, dollop the batter on top of the chili and cook for 2 more hours on low or 1 hour on high, until the dumplings are puffed and tender.
If using, garnish the chili with jalapeño, cilantro, and green onions.
